title: China targeting aircraft manufacturing industry in spy schemes, experts say
description: For years, FBI Director Christopher Wray has been warning about the threat from China on American national security. Experts say technology from aircraft manufacturers is one of China’s biggest targets. CNBC’s Eamon Javers reports on how one GE aviation engineer fell victim to a Chinese spy scheme.

title: Underwater noise heard amid search for submersible exploring Titanic wreckage
description: Planes, ships and drones are now aggressively searching for the missing submersible in a grid near the sunken Titanic wreckage. Canadian air crews report hearing unusual noise in the water. NBC News’ Tom Costello has the latest updates.

title: Deep sea expert discusses search for Titanic submersible
description: Oceanographer and deep sea explorer David Gallo speaks with Lester Holt about the ongoing search for the submersible that went missing while exploring the Titanic’s wreckage. Gallo discusses the underwater sounds reportedly heard and the depleting air supply onboard.

title: See the Titanic wreckage more than 100 years later
description: Photos show remnants of the Titanic luxury cruise ship more than 100 years after it sunk to the ocean floor after colliding with an iceberg.

title: A tale of two disasters: Missing Titanic sub captivates the world days after deadly migrant shipwreck
description: After a fishing boat carrying migrants from Libya to Italy sank, leaving hundreds dead, the story has been overshadowed by a search for a handful of wealthy people.

title: The Titanic brought them together, and a tiny vessel could doom them
description: Five men came together to see the remnants of one of history’s great disasters, the Titanic. They are now at the center of a frantic search-and-rescue operation.

title: Brazil seizes world's biggest illegal shark fin consignment
description: Brazilian authorities said on Monday they had seized 28.7 metric tonnes of illegally obtained shark fins that would be exported to Asia, in what they called the world’s largest confiscation of its kind at the origin.

title: Surface search area for missing submersible double the size of Connecticut
description: The size of the search area for the missing Titanic submersible has been expanded. Coast Guard Capt. Jamie Frederick said the surface search area is two times the size of the state of Connecticut.

title: Ukraine conference grapples with ‘years and years’ of rebuilding needs
description: KHARKIV, Ukraine — When she wakes up every morning, she looks for new cracks in the ceiling.

title: French filmmaker Luc Besson cleared of all charges in rape case
description: French filmmaker Luc Besson has been definitively cleared of all charges in the rape case involving the Belgian-Dutch female actor Sand Van Roy.

title: Multiple people hospitalized after Paris explosion
description: A suspected gas explosion in the French capital has destroyed a building that housed, among other organizations, the Paris American Academy, a design and fashion school founded in 1965.

title: Full interview: Blinken discusses Beijing trip and U.S.-China relations
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken sat down with NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer to discuss his trip to Beijing and how he is working to stabilize ties with China.

title: Rome’s newest tourist spot: The site where Julius Caesar was assassinated
description: An ancient square where historians believe Julius Caesar was stabbed to death — one of the most infamous assassinations in history — was opened to the public for the first time Tuesday.

title: An ancient Mayan empire city was found in the Mexican jungle
description: A previously unknown ancient Maya city was discovered in the jungles of southern Mexico; anthropologists said it was likely an important center 1,000 years ago.

title: Families grieve outside Honduran prison after riot kills 41 women
description: A deadly riot caused by gang members in a Honduran women's prison caused the deaths of 41 inmates. Outside of the prison, relatives of the inmates could be seen grieving and waiting for answers.

title: Palestinians fatally shoot 4 Israelis, spurring West Bank revenge attacks
description: Two Palestinian attackers opened fire at a restaurant and gas station near an Israeli settlement in the West Bank on Tuesday, killing four Israelis and wounding several other people before they were shot dead, authorities said, as violence roiled the occupied territory the day after a deadly Israeli military raid.

title: Elon Musk meets with Indian leader Narendra Modi, calling himself a ‘fan’
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says he is “incredibly excited about the future of India,” adding that it has “more promise than any large country in the world.”

title: Once starved by war, millions of Ethiopians go hungry again as U.S., U.N. pause aid after massive theft
description: An Orthodox Christian priest, Tesfa Kiros Meresfa begs door-to-door for food along with countless others recovering from a two-year war in northern Ethiopia that starved his people.

title: 41 women die in grisly riot in Honduran prison blamed on gangs
description: A grisly riot at a women’s prison in Honduras Tuesday left at least 41 women dead, most burned to death, in violence the country’s president blamed on “mara” street gangs that often wield broad power inside penitentiaries.

title: Andrew Tate indicted on charges of rape and human trafficking
description: Online influencer Andrew Tate, known for his controversial views on women, will face trial in Romania on charges including rape and human trafficking. The indictment follows Tate's initial arrest in December that led to him and his brother Tristan being placed on house arrest. NBC's Ali Arouzi has the details.

title: Search for missing submersible a 'monumental' task
description: Tim Taylor, CEO of Tiburon Subsea and an ocean explorer, describes the challenges facing those searching for the missing Titan submersible as the amount of oxygen left inside continues to drop.

title: Biden calls Chinese President Xi a dictator
description: President Joe Biden called Chinese President Xi Jinping a dictator, adding that Xi was very embarrassed when a Chinese balloon was blown off course over the U.S.
